Description: Marl pottery vase with flat base and barrel-shaped body with interior ledge rim, which was pierced before firing with four holes, possibly for suspension; exterior coated with buff-coloured slip with faint traces of red paint splashes and strokes; red paint loosely applied around interior rim.
Curator's comments: Illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xix.59b; Late ware L75D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Lid for this vessel is EA 30884.
